Description: Small fragment of a seal-impression, the rear shows impressions of textile, the side a turned string. The fine brown Nile clay has few inclusions of mica and was hardened after excavation before a proper cleaning. The top part is rounded at the edges and covered with finger impressions, there are several cracks in the surface. The seal shows a standing human figure in a striding posture, facing to the left. Behind it a round sign, maybe a sun disc?
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
